3.heading: Whitmore, Glenn.
3.title: "From the Heart"
3.author: Dan Jurgens, writer ; Ron Frenz and Joe Rubinstein, art ; John Costanza, letters ; Glenn Whitmore, colors ; Digital Chameleon, seps
notes: Cover title: The Quest of Lois Lane.
Guest starring Wonder Woman, Lori Lemaris.

Summary: Lois goes to Bhutran in the Himalayas to investigate a heroin story and meets a priest who takes her up a mountain for a spiritual revelation, which helps her decide to go back and marry Clark. Mean while Wonder Woman is helping Superman investigate his lack of powers and his feelings towards Lois.

50.heading: Whitney, Ogden, 1918-
50.title: "Lady in Evening Clothes"
50.author: Gardner Fox, script ; Ogden Whitney, art
50.appears_in: 10 p. in Adventure Comics, no. 47 (Feb. 1940) ; reprinted in Golden Age Sandman Archives, v. 1.
notes: Introduction of Diana Belmont, also known as Diana Ware, and District Attorney Belmont, her father. Villains are Trigger Hunt and Black Bill Trent.
Wesley Dodds is called a "steel magnate" in this story.
Data from Bob Cherry, Gene Reed, Lou Mougin, et al., via Grand Comics Database Project.

57.appears_in: 10 p. in Adventure Comics, no. 46 (Jan. 1940) ; reprinted in Golden Age Sandman Archives, v. 1.
